claudia wolsperg upon lavandt neer steirmark reckoned town thereof lavamundt border episcopall see situate influx river dravus freisach town much antiquity seated oleza spittall c strange observable ceremony archduke austria acknowledged duke carinthia take munster meadowes adjoining town veit certain countreyman office inheritance belongeth sitteth marble stone holding right hand cow black calf left hand mare lean rake cometh new duke attired plain rustick habit courtier attending richest apparell whose approach countryman mentioned demandeth hee majestically cometh thitherward people answer future duke hee againe asketh whether judge one maintaine liberty countrey sincerity religion people answer asketh right displace marble seat steward new duke house replyeth hee shall give thee penny silver cattell standing thee cloathes hath time thy house shall ever free taxe tribute fellow upon taking duke hand bidding good prince giveth gentle cuffe eare setting marble stone taking away cattell departeth done new duke goeth saint vites church done devotion putteth rustick weedes dresseth clothes befitting prince ceremony acknowledged carniola dutch called krain environed sclavonia rest thraldome long groaned till tartarian divided amongst grown lesse terrible neighbour outed power command valour john son basilius thereupon changed title lord duke great duke fortune thrived yet great contented homager tartar finally agreed end war tartar relinquish hold country side every year within castle mosco great duke standing foot feed horse crim tartar oat cap homage basilius changed boot moscovite onely able assert soveraignty hath also wrested many goodly province prince country shall trouble self see doe tracing succession farre time augustus caesar neither rossi moschi footing juridicall resort whole province whence neighbouring mountaines name scardonici bound country croatia ancient name country liburnia said extending northward beyond mountain ardium scardonici dalmatia membra dividentia whole illyricum people hereof called one generall name liburni much given piracy better speed therein author inventers swift vessel called liburnicae liburnae thus horace ibis liburnis inter alta navium amice propugnacula say liburnian shalt thou amongst stoutest ship sea imitation vessel swift light roman time wealth pride invented kinde chair litter call sedan wherein carried men shoulder ease pleasure could sleep read write also porter bearer nation commonly whence fashion vessel resemble called liburni thus juvenal third satyre si vocat officium turba cedente vehetur dive ingenti curret super os liburno atque obiter leget aut scribet vel dormiet intus namque facit somnum clausa lectica fenestra thus englished honoured friend sir robert stapleton excellent
